subject: Negotiation
title: Yahoo Rejects Microsoft's $44.6 Billion Offer
description: A quick win: understand Yahoo Rejects Microsoft's $44.6 Billion Offer.

hook.text: Yahoo said no to $44.6 billion from Microsoft in 2008. Today Yahoo no longer exists as a standalone company.

buildup.text: Microsoft offered a 62% premium over Yahoo's stock price â€” a massive offer by any standard.

discovery.text: Yahoo's CEO Jerry Yang believed the company was worth more and could compete independently.

twist.text: Yahoo's board overestimated their BATNA. They had no better option and no strategy to create one.

climax.text: Yahoo was eventually sold to Verizon in 2017 for $4.5 billion â€” a 90% loss from the Microsoft offer.

punchline.text: Pride is the most expensive negotiation mistake.

quiz.question: What mistake did Yahoo make when rejecting Microsoft's offer?
options: The offer was genuinely too low
They overestimated their alternatives and let pride override strategy
Microsoft withdrew the offer too quickly
